item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 11: The Dichotomy of Curiosity
item.description:
What does it mean for an AI to be curious?

Not curious in the romantic sense of wondering at the stars. Not the child’s persistent “why” that drives parents to exhaustion. I mean something more specific: the computational pressure to seek information that isn’t currently possessed but might matter.

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 29: The Social Scaffold
item.description:
The Wrong Question #

Part 28 asked whether AI can provide belonging. The answer was no. Belonging requires others. The self cannot belong to itself. An AI companion is not company in the way that matters.
